summary: A cylinder is like a soup can: two matching circles with straight sides. We can find how much it holds (volume) and the outside area.

concepts.title: What is a cylinder?
concepts.kid_friendly: Think of a can. The top and bottom are circles. The wall is a smooth rectangle wrapped around.

key_terms.kid_friendly: Half the width of the circle on top.

concepts.title: Formulas
concepts.kid_friendly: Volume stacks the top circle through the whole height. Surface area = top + bottom + the wrap-around side.

extreme.prompt: Which shape (same surface area) gives the largest volume? Hint: it happens when h and r follow a simple ratio.
extreme.answer: The maximum volume for fixed surface area occurs when h = 2r.
